intro: Camellia pallida, commonly known as the pale camellia, is a flowering plant native to eastern Asia. It is characterized by its glossy, dark green leaves and striking white to pale pink flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. The plant is a member of the Theaceae family and is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens. Camellia pallida prefers well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a versatile addition to various landscapes. Its flowers are also used in traditional Chinese medicine for their purported health benefits.
